 019:     """Binary search for sigmas of conditional Gaussians.
 020: 
 021:     This approximation reduces the computational complexity from O(N^2) to
 022:     O(uN). See the exact method '_binary_search_perplexity' for more details.
 023: 
 024:     Parameters
 025:     ----------
 026:     affinities : array-like, shape (n_samples, k)
 027:         Distances between training samples and its k nearest neighbors.
 028: 
 029:     neighbors : array-like, shape (n_samples, k) or None
 030:         Each row contains the indices to the k nearest neigbors. If this
 031:         array is None, then the perplexity is estimated over all data
 032:         not just the nearest neighbors.
 033: 
 034:     desired_perplexity : float
 035:         Desired perplexity (2^entropy) of the conditional Gaussians.
 036: 
 037:     verbose : int
 038:         Verbosity level.
 039: 
 040:     Returns
 041:     -------
 042:     P : array, shape (n_samples, n_samples)
 043:         Probabilities of conditional Gaussian distributions p_i|j.
 044:     B : array, shape (n_samples)
 045:         Scaling factors beta_i = 1 / (2*sigma_i**2) containing the sigma values of the Gaussian.
 046:     """
